page.title: 13PETERHEAD HARBOUR
page.content: In Peterhead there are 2 harbours; North and South. The Breakwaters, which were built by prisoners, help to break the strong force of water from the North Sea. Peterhead is often referred to as the 'Harbour of Refuge'. Around the harbour can be seen many jetties, 2 ice factories and a dry dock for repairing vessels.The new Harbour Office is situated near to the site of the old fish market. The new larger fish market is at the North Harbour. The Coastguard services are based in Keith House near here.The Lifeboat Station is on the outskirts of the South Harbour.There is a large bridge in the harbour which Peterhead people call the 'Queenie'.There is also a new road which was built on reclaimed land.
